intro: Waltheria scabra, commonly known as the roughleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or disturbed areas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Waltheria scabra is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
